newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa March gold/forex reserves 13.1 bln rand.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa March gold/forex reserves 13.1 bln rand.

text.p: The South African Reserve Bank said on Tuesday provisional gross gold and foreign exchange reserves amounted to 13.1 billion rand at March 31, 1997 compared to 12.5 billion rand at February 28.
The central bank said that during the month it increased its usage of foreign credit lines, bringing the total utilised to 2.5 billion rand.
Last month the bank utilised foreign credit lines to the value of 2.1 billion rand in part to fund the redemption of South Africa's ECU 250 million rand bond issue which fell due on February 10.
"The first of eight quarterly tranches of the IMF Compensatory and Contingency Financing Facility amounting to 494 million rand was repaid during March 1997," it said in a statement.
According to a Reuters consensus poll of nine economists, gross reserves were expected to rise in March to between 11.5 to 13.5 billion rand with the consensus at 12.58 billion rand.
